hints.content:
To find the number of meters she completed before she fell, we start with the $\blue{100}$ meter distance of the race and subtract the $\pink{35}$ meters she ran after the fall.

$\blue{100}-\pink{35} = \green{\Box}$


![](${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/7f113093271f82155bd3c87839e69d36.png)
The hurdler ran $\green{65}$ meters before she fell.

question.content:
An Olympic hurdler was part of the way through her race when she fell.  She got up and completed the final $35$ meters of her $100$ meter race.  

**How many meters did she complete before she fell?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] meters
